timeline.subject: Bastien Stablo
timeline.details: Procureur for canons informed that Stablo charged with stealing bread; asks for information to be taken

timeline.subject: Bastien Stablo
timeline.details: Procureur notes Stablo absented himself from confrontation with Claudette femme George Mengin; asks for further depositions and arrest

timeline.subject: Bastien Stablo
timeline.details: First interrogation; denied being witch, admitted taking loaf but intended to pay; constant denials of all charges

timeline.subject: Bastien Stablo
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; accused some witnesses of theft and other crimes; denied all charges

timeline.subject: Bastien Stablo
timeline.details: Procureur d'office (Clement) asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Bastien Stablo
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves torture (ordinaire only)

timeline.subject: Bastien Stablo
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confessed as soon as questioned; admitted pact with devil Percin, multiple murders and maleficia, attendance at sabbat

timeline.subject: Bastien Stablo
timeline.details: Additional interrogation; added names of accomplices

timeline.subject: Bastien Stablo
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

economic_context.details: Stablo described as 'assez aizé' (fairly well-off) with property worth 700-2000 francs and wheat in his loft, yet caught stealing bread multiple times. Worked as laboureur and forester. Had business arrangement carting firewood but cheated partners. Testimony emphasizes paradox of man of means stealing food. Discussion of dearth and high grain prices at assembly. Theft could not be from necessity given his wealth.

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial triggered by theft accusations but evolved into witchcraft prosecution. Stablo had two previous witchcraft trials (1592 and ~2 years before 1610) but withstood torture and was released. Economic paradox central to case: man of substantial means (700-2000 francs property) repeatedly stealing bread. Under torture confessed quickly, claiming he had been 'fort robuste' at previous trial. Mother executed as witch 1592. Confessed to multiple murders using magical powder given by devil. Trial shows pattern of long-standing reputation (25+ years) without legal action until theft provided opening.
